page.title: 12ANIMALS IN PENNARD.
page.content: ONE OF THE MOST COMMON MAMMALS IN PENNARD IS THE RABBIT.YOU CAN SEE THEM AT DUSK AND EARLY IN THE MORNING. NOW THE NUMBERS ARE INCREASING AND THEY ARE BECOMING A NUISANCE. ON THE WAY UP FROM POBBLES BEACH THERE IS A SMALL RABBIT WARREN WITH HOLES THAT BRANCH OFF IN TO A MAZE OF TUNNELS. WILD PONIES ARE FOUND IN PENNARD TOO. THEY ROAM INTO PEOPLE'S GARDENS AND ROAM AROUND THE STREETS.THE PEOPLE WHO LIVE NEAR FEED THEM.SOME HOUSES HAVE CATTLE GRIDS AND OUR SCHOOL DOES, SO THE PONIES CAN NOT GET IN. OUR CLASS COUNTED OVER THIRTY BIRDS THAT THEY SEE IN OUR AREA AT LEAST ONCE A YEAR. THEY INCLUDED OWLS, HERONS, BUZZARDS, KESTRELS AND TREE CREEPERS. FOXHOLE IS THE NEAREST BEACH TO ME AND I GO THERE OFTEN. ON THIS BEACH YOU CAN FIND LOTS OF CREATURES IN THE ROCK POOLS AND IN THE SAND.I FOUND A TROPICAL BEAN THERE
